alert.note: Alert for San Francisco; San Mateo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 29 at 9:57AM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT... Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following counties, San Francisco and San Mateo. * WHEN...Until 100 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 955 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain moving towards the San Mateo Coast. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Francisco, Daly City, San Mateo, Redwood City, South San Francisco, San Bruno, Pacifica, Burlingame, San Carlos, Belmont, Millbrae, Half Moon Bay, Hillsborough, Woodside, Highlands-Baywood Park, El Granada, Brisbane, Colma, Highlands and Montara. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
